    "a cornerstone of combinatorial commutative algebra is the connection between simplicial complexes and ideals generated by squarefree monomials , also known as _",
    "reisner ideals_. one of the fundamental results in this theory is reisner s criterion ( theorem  [ thm : reisner ] ) , which expresses the cohen ",
    "macaulayness of a stanley  reisner ring as a topological condition on the corresponding simplicial complex .",
    "these ideas can be adapted to study monomial ideals @xmath2 that are not squarefree . for instance , _ polarization _ produces a squarefree monomial ideal that shares many important properties with  @xmath2 .",
    "however , this construction introduces ( many ) new variables , making it impractical from a computational standpoint ( see example  [ ex : polarization ] ) .",
    "in contrast , the _ distraction _ of a monomial ideal @xmath2 ( used in hartshorne s work on the hilbert scheme @xcite ) has many of the features of its polarization , without the increase in dimension .",
    "while the distraction of @xmath2 is not a monomial ideal unless @xmath2 is squarefree , it can be studied using a finite family of simplicial complexes , called _ exponent complexes _ ( see definition  [ def : deltab ] ) .",
    "distractions arise naturally in the algebraic study of differential equations .",

    "monomial ideals and their distractions are @xmath13-homogeneous and have the same holomorphic solutions when considered as systems of differential equations . while this solution space is usually infinite dimensional , its subspace of @xmath13-homogeneous solutions of any particular degree is finite dimensional ( see definition  [ def : rank ] ) .",
    "one captures these solutions by adding _ euler operators _ to these ideals , where a chosen degree is viewed as a parameter .    in this article",
    "we compute the dimension of the @xmath13-homogeneous holomorphic solutions of @xmath2 as a function of the parameters .",
    "our starting point is theorem  [ thm : ek - homology ] , which provides a strong link between the koszul homology of @xmath9/\\tilde{i}$ ] with respect to the euler operators and the @xmath13-graded structure of the local cohomology of @xmath3/i$ ] at the maximal ideal .",

    "this work was inspired by the theory of @xmath13-hypergeometric differential equations , whose intuition and techniques are employed throughout , especially those developed in @xcite . as we apply results from partial differential equations in sections  [ sec : apply - mmw ] and  [ sec : s - r expts ] , we use the ground field @xmath17 . our techniques in section  [ sec : primary complex ] are entirely homological and thus work over any field of characteristic zero .",
